subject: Read proc temps and dimm temps
commitMessage:
Read proc temps and dimm temps

This commit uses openpower-occ-control to monitor the temperature and
power sensors, and create sensors on D-BUS. In the loop, read the
sensor values every 1 seconds.

Tested:
I use virtual data to get sensor values:
busctl tree org.open_power.OCC.Control
|-/org
| `-/org/open_power
|   `-/org/open_power/control
|     |-/org/open_power/control/occ0
|     `-/org/open_power/control/occ1
`-/xyz
  `-/xyz/openbmc_project
    `-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors
      |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p0_mem_2_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p0_mem_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p0_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p1_mem_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p1_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p2_mem_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p2_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p3_mem_power
      | |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/p3_power
      | `-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/total_power
      `-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/dimm5_dram_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/dimm9_dram_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/proc0_core2_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/proc0_core3_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/proc1_core2_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/proc1_core3_temp
        |-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/vrm_vdd0_temp
        `-/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/vrm_vdd1_temp

busctl introspect org.open_power.OCC.Control
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/temperature/proc0_core3_temp
NAME                                TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable interface -         -
.Introspect                         method    -         s
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer           interface -         -
.GetMachineId                       method    -         s
.Ping                               method    -         -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties     interface -         -
.Get                                method    ss        v
.GetAll                             method    s         a{sv}
.Set                                method    ssv       -
.PropertiesChanged                  signal    sa{sv}as  -
xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value    interface -         -
.MaxValue                           property  d         0
.MinValue                           property  d         0
.Unit                               property  s         "xyz.openbmc...
.Value                              property  d         49
xyz.openbmc_project.State.Decorator.OperationalStatus interface -  -
.Functional                         property  b  true

busctl introspect org.open_power.OCC.Control
/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/power/total_power
NAME                                TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable interface -         -
.Introspect                         method    -         s
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer           interface -         -
.GetMachineId                       method    -         s
.Ping                               method    -         -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties     interface -         -
.Get                                method    ss        v
.GetAll                             method    s         a
.Set                                method    ssv       -
.PropertiesChanged                  signal    sa{sv}as  -
xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value    interface -         -
.MaxValue                           property  d         0
.MinValue                           property  d         0
.Unit                               property  s         "xyz.openbmc...
.Value                              property  d         83
xyz.openbmc_project.State.Decorator.OperationalStatus interface -  -
.Functional                         property  b  true

Signed-off-by: Chicago Duan <duanzhijia01@inspur.com>
Change-Id: Iff30ab51745dab500fa19aa4c35b07e0052ac665

Patch Set 27:

This is looking pretty good.  I was hoping I could give it a test, but need some code from hostboot, who is waiting on some PLDM code from the BMC.

Patch Set 27:

(1 comment)

Looks good overall but I think we need to handle errors reading from the hwmon files.
Uploaded patch set 28: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 27.

Patch Set 28: Ok-To-Test+1

User approved, CI ok to start
Change has been successfully merged by Matt Spinler

as above

Also, I think can you replace them with `enum class`?
need to check whether this value is `std::nullopt`
Can’t get fruTypeValue using uint8_t. I think we should use uint32_t
Please define it as a constant in the configure.ac
Remove const & and replace it with `uint8_t`
I think we'll need the temps updated every second as opposed to 10.  Can probably just change the poll interval.

We have an unfortunate case where code in the same flash image has to support different numbers of CPUs:
2 and 4 for Rainier, 8 for Everest

This MAX_CPUS is used other places in the repo too.  I guess we should figure out a way to get the actual number of processors to use in these cases.

So how do we solve this? Maybe we can read the machine name from EEPROM, which needs some bytes to store the machine name in EEPROM. And we need set the correct machine name to EEPROM when the motherboard is produced. After we get the machine name, we can set the MAX_CPUS to the correct value.
we'll probably need some compile feature around this, so that we don't mess with existing systems.
Chris, now that the OCC will be polled every second, are any changes required here?  Maybe just have this also be called every second before the temps are read and then we can go back to one timer?
No changes required here.  This can get called every second.   Yes, should only need one timer.

https://github.com/ibm-openbmc/dev/issues/2150  mentions other fru types that would require different sensor names.  I guess if you would rather not put these in due to a good way to test them, I could probably put them in later.

There will be one OCCStatus object per OCC, so maybe you can just count those instead?  Ideally it would also know if the OCCs were active, so you wouldn't have to check it yourself here.

This would at least solve the immediate problem of how this code would know how many OCCs are in the system.  We still need to solve it for the OCCStatus objects, but maybe Chris can take a crack at that.
if you break here, won't this skip setting the other temp sensors on that same OCC?
I'm not seeing a reason this needs to be a unique pointer?
There is no reason to have two different timers.  We only want to send one POLL request to the OCC to gather data, so remove this and use pollerTimerExpired().
Maybe INFO or ERR since this is probably a bug.

We still have the big vs small core dilemma here.  The OCC only knows about smaller cores, but the system is most likely configured in big core mode (2 small cores per big core).

What do you think Chris, just do (instanceID / 2) here?
could also just do:  for (const auto& [sensorPath, id] : existingSensors)

Hi Matt,
When OCC does not activate, do we need to set OperationalStatus to false？

What the dbus-sensors and phosphor-regulators sensor apps do to show the temperature isn't available is use the Availability interface: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/State/Decorator/Availability.interface.yaml and also set the value to NaN.  I think that would work here too.
can you add some comments about what is going on here?
I think 'analyzePowerLableValue' sounds a bit better. Second option is 'powerLabelAnalysis'.
there is one of these per processor, so I think you'll also need the id in the name, like you did for cores.  Also, looks like all the other sensors are lower case so this probably should be too.
No. If we use class , the type is open_power::occ::occFruType and cannot be compared with fruTypeValue(uint32_t).
only need to do this if reading temps is enabled?
I can't tell, does this default to off if --enable/disable-read-occ-temp isn't passed in? I think we will want it to.
Done. I've modified it and now it's off by default.

it turns out the label value is in decimal:

# grep . temp1_*
temp1_fault:0
temp1_fru_type:0
temp1_input:34000
temp1_label:3221225472
temp1_max:85000

So I guess you could either convert that into a hex string for checkLabelValue(), or change it to take a uint32_t.
i did this with a different commit.

So in the event of an OCC error or SBE error, reading from these files will fail. I think that will throw an exception and crash the app. But I think we will need to handle those errors in various ways, so we don't want to crash.

I think the driver only actually does the poll at once a second max?  is there a way we could use this knowledge to only have to deal with an error path at a certain point in the code instead of on every file access?

Possibly? I think it would be hard to guarantee though since the app doesn't know when the driver will hit it's 1 second timer. Plus, the error from the bad poll will be returned on every file access until a new poll is attempted.

OK.

I don't think an ifstream will throw unless you tell it to, but yea then tempValue won't have a valid valid in it so it would need to check for inputFile.fail() or something along those lines
